page.title: 18DEWSBURY FIRE STATION
page.content: The present station was built at Scouthill in 1964. It has a staff of { {72 firemen}split up into two shifts _ the day shift from 9.00am until 6.00pm, and the evening shift from 6.00pm until 9.00am. There are{4 fire {engines}with up to 6 men manning one engine. Nowadays, a fireman's duty is more than just fighting fires. There is{ {constant drill}with all equipment, security fire checks in various local buildings, water supply checks and map making. This reflects the view that the fire brigade has a much wider public role to play today as an emergency service. A list of{outside {calls for 1984}substantiates this:-{ {Fires:}large 58; small 197; grass 83; chimney 11.{Special Service Calls:}50. {False Alarms:}genuine 158; hoax 104. {Calls into other localities:}192.
